title: Marvel 'Moon Knight' Actor Gaspard Ulliel Dies at Age 37 After Ski Accident; César award-winning French actor was tapped to play Midnight Man in the new miniseries on Disney+
text:
"We are deeply saddened to learn of the tragic passing of our friend and colleague Gaspard Ulliel," a spokesperson for Walt Disney Co. said in a statement. "Our thoughts are with his family and friends during this time."

Representatives for the actor didn't immediately respond to requests for comment Wednesday.

Mr. Ulliel is perhaps best known globally for his portrayal of a young Hannibal Lecter in the 2007 film "Hannibal Rising" and for starring opposite French actress Audrey Tautou in 2004's "A Very Long Engagement." He won the 2017 César Award for Best Actor, France's equivalent of an Oscar, for his lead role in Xavier Dolan's film "It's Only the End of the World." Earlier in his career, he won the César for Most Promising Male Newcomer in 2005, an award he was also nominated for in 2003 and 2004.

In Marvel's coming series "Moon Knight," Mr. Ulliel plays Anton Mogart / Midnight Man. The television series stars Oscar Isaac, Ethan Hawke and May Calamawy and premieres March 30 on Disney+.

French officials and actors shared their condolences as news of his death spread Wednesday.

"Gaspard Ulliel grew up with film and film grew up with him. They loved each other madly," said French Prime Minister Jean Castex in a tweet, translated from French.

Jean Dujardin, who won the Academy Award for Best Actor for the 2011 film "The Artist," shared an image of Mr. Ulliel on his Instagram account with a black heart emoji.

Write to Jennifer Calfas at jennifer.calfas@wsj.com

Marvel 'Moon Knight' Actor Gaspard Ulliel Dies at Age 37 After Ski Accident
